componentInstanceProperties.value: Invest in simple, frictionless Co2 measurement and reduction solutions

componentInstanceProperties.name: summaryText

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: A Climate FinTech Using Technology For Good

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Approx. 70% of consumers expect banks to provide eco-friendly payment solutions. Verrency educates consumers about their consumption carbon footprint and provides easy ways to offset that Co2 pollution footprint, all fully integrated into the way they pay for goods and services with their cards and digital wallets. Integrated seamlessly into banks' digital payment flows, Verrency ensures a frictionless consumer experience and offers banks a viable and simple way to adopt voluntary carbon reduction initiatives that are good for people and our planet.

Verrency’s commitment to compliance and risk management makes it an attractive choice for banking clients. The company has a strong global presence in the financial services sector which has allowed it to also integrate into banks' rewards programs and merchant cash-back schemes. As a partner in Visa’s Eco Bundle suite of sustainable products in APAC and CEMEA, Verrency has already signed 3 banks, including top-tier Malaysian bank Maybank, and has 25 banks in its constantly growing pipeline. Currently, the company makes $1.15 million ARR with an anticipated 110% YoY growth.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Quality assured by EY and with significant IP including patents and trademarks under their belt, Verrency provides access to local carbon offset projects as well as other sustainability initiatives, and the team’s years of experience in banking enables them to strategise with clients to enhance portfolio profitability as well.

With funding from this round, Verrency will scale its Co2 solution globally, primarily investing in sales, marketing, product development and customer success resources aligned with revenue growth for healthy EBITDA growth.

Verrency's unique position at the intersection of the sustainable FinTech market and ClimateTech makes it an enticing opportunity for wholesale impact investors.

componentInstanceProperties.name: firstImgFooterText
componentInstanceProperties.value: A distribution agreement with Visa has led to signing 3 banks, including top-tier Malaysian bank Maybank and 25 banks in their pipeline. Lead investors Salter Brothers and Perennial have invested $4,000,000 in this round.

componentInstanceProperties.name: secondImgFooterText
componentInstanceProperties.value: Verrency's current Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) for FY23 is $1.15 million, with a projected FY24 budget of $2.4 million, signifying 110% YoY growth.

componentInstanceProperties.name: thirdImgFooterText
componentInstanceProperties.value:
The global voluntary carbon market is projected to reach $250 billion by 2050, with a 17%+ CAGR.* Verrency estimates the addressable market today at $4 billion and aims for an initial market share of approximately 2%, translating to an ARR of around $80 million.
*source: morganstanley.com

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
The Offer

Verrency is raising a round of Series A equity, enabling you to own shares in this company. This investment opportunity is open to wholesale and pre-approved investors, and you can invest from $5000.
Register now to get early access to the live deal.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Don't miss out! There's a limited allocation for this offering.

Questions? Read our Frequently Asked Questions or reach out to Jeroen van Son: jeroen.van.son@verrency.com

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
How Tech for Good is Combating Climate Change


Ready to learn how digital payments can positively impact the environment? Watch our fireside chat with Verrency CEO Jeroen Van Son. Learn more about this revolutionary FinTech solution and how you can get involved in the fight against climate change.

Watch now

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: Jeroen van Son is a highly experienced entrepreneur and digital payments executive with over 25 years in global financial services and digital payments, including senior roles with Westpac, Mastercard, Paypal, and Virgin.

Strong Intellectual Property

Verrency holds a valuable portfolio of patents, patent applications, trademarks, copyrights, proprietary processes, relationships, and know-how, and is EY quality assured, providing a solid foundation for innovation and growth.
